meanings.definition: To position in a line for gunfire.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers enfilade themselves along the wall for better aim.
meanings.sent2: The archers enfilade their arrows towards the target.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels enfilade their acorns in a neat row.
meanings.sent4: The students enfilade their desks in perfect alignment.
meanings.sent5: The gardeners enfilade the flowers for a stunning display.

meanings.definition: A position of troops or guns in a line for firing on a target.
meanings.sent1: The army set up an enfilade to attack the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The cannons were arranged in enfilade to maximize their impact.
meanings.sent3: The toys on the shelf formed a colorful enfilade.
meanings.sent4: The books on the shelf stood in enfilade, waiting to be read.
meanings.sent5: The trees in the orchard created a natural enfilade for protection.
